description.narrative: Refugee settlements in Sudan (Gedaref) are threatened by floods during the upcoming rainy season. UNHCR requested speciliast expertise to map and model the possible waterflows and to advice on drainage design. A team of experts is formed and the team will:• Undertake a detailed technical assessment of flood risks in the new refugee sites for the refugee influx from Ethiopia;Lead the coordination the assessment with operational and implementing partners;• Aassist in the planning, organization and oversight of site investigations, surveys and analyses of existing buildings, feasibility studies, structural inspections and assessments and preparation of assessment of associated reports. Issue a comprehensive technical report;• Based on the assessment findings, develop BoQs and tendering documentation for a contractor to carry out required earthworks to mitigate floods; supervise the contractor appointed;• Develop practical guidelines for all sectors for flood mitigating measures in the development of the sites, and coordinate the implementation of the guidelines; • To monitor and inspect off-site and on-site work for compliance to applicable codes, accepted engineering practices and Sudanese laws.• Work closely with the site planners and technical specialists in the response.
